Integrity, intelligence and energy. If you don\'t have the first one, the other two will kill you.

column1: Value Investing: From Graham to Buffett and Beyond
column3: Their office - Castle Schloss has one room - is spare; they don\'t visit companies; they rarely speak to management; they don\'t speak to analysts; and they don\'t use the Internet. Page 264.
Even Buffett's genius lies more in running businesses than in picking stocks. More here.
In 1900, a French graduate student named Louis Bachelier completed a dense thesis called Theory of Speculation, in which he concluded that prices follow a random walk- More here.

Bachelier described the market as an 'aggregate of speculators' who 'at a given instant can believe in neither a market rise nor a market fall, since, for each quoted price, there are as many buyers as sellers. More here.
